content: and bpdc pattern in single_crochet stitches of heel to end of round keep an eye on your stitch count as it tends to inadvertently increase during this round if necessary do a pd2tog to maintain the same stitch count that you had before the heel slip_stitch in first bpdc ch2 44 48 52 56 60 st © figpox farms designs pg 5 o you may have some gaps at each corner of the heel but you can work those closed with leftover yarn when working in ends  r2 bpdc in 1st stitch *fpdc in next stitch bpdc in next stitch * repeat * to * up to last single_crochet continue repositioning markers as you go fpdc in in last stitch join round with slip_stitch in starting bpdc not in ch2 after joining round ch2 44 48 52 56 60 st  r3 repeat round 2  repeat round 3 until your sock leg is as long as you want it weigh skein if you need to in order to ensure you have enough left to do the second sock amount of yarn remaining should weigh slightly more than half the total weight of the skein as you still need to work the cuff maintain stitch count throughout cuff  r1 bphdc in first stitch and repeat to end ch2 44 48 52 56 60 st  r2 repeat round 2  repeat round 2 twice more or as many times as you like to get the cuff curl you desire while still having enough yarn left to complete the second sock finish off finishing  repeat pattern from beginning to make second sock  work in ends  check corners of heel for gaps if you find any you may close them up by stitching them together with any leftover yarn in your skein sock heels bear a lot of stress so closing gaps now will help their durability…and keep you from having to darn them  wet block socks on sock blockers or on actual living feet it works for custom-fitting 501 levi s jeans why not socks  wear your bespoke socks until they have been patched and repatched to within an inch of their lives and then use them in a scrap rag blanket because you love them so much you can t bear to toss them we hope you enjoy your finished furrow socks please tag your projects on social media and ravelry with # figpoxfarmsdesigns pg 6
